head.title: The Perfect Equipment For Reading or Fantasizing

hedline.hl1: The Perfect Equipment For Reading or Fantasizing

abstract.p: Personal Shopper column on hammocks; photos (M)

block.p: THERE is nothing lower tech than a hammock, but it seems to be this summer's high-tech-shopping winner. Some Web sites specialize in hammocks, many of them handmade. Abbey Lee and her husband, Ben, of Lubbock, Tex., own green-eggs.com., which sells a full selection of hammocks, including handmade ones from Mexico and Nicaragua. The site's sales have tripled since last summer. ''It's a great way to relax in a stressful world,'' Ms. Lee said, adding that people seem to like the hand-woven pieces, each one unique. There are countless hammock accessories available online, from stands (for those who don't have trees), pillows and liners to canopies, mosquito netting and hardware. And for those who prefer to do their swinging in the shade, there are portable outdoor awnings and collapsible gazebos.

1, 2. A colorful shark-shaped child's hammock is like a tent for playing or napping. The entrance is through the shark's mouth. It costs $79.95 from www.hammacherschlemmer.com, or (800) 233-4800. 3. The white Caribbean hammock, with a hand-crocheted border, is made of tightly woven cotton cord. It comes in two sizes; for one person, $85; for two, $95. From www.green-eggs.com, or (806) 785-3188. 4. The Summertime Hammock set includes a striped hammock in muted shades of red, white and green, a pillow with a watermelon design that attaches with ties, and two small striped pillows (not shown). It is $188, and available from www.goodhome.com, or (877) 642-2487. 5. The Shade Sail by Coolaroo (www.coolaroo .com) is a canopy that comes in yellow or green for gardens, pools, terraces or any courtyard space. The manufacturers say the washable knitted polyester fabric blocks 90 percent of the sun's UV rays. It can be attached to trees, fences or posts and comes as a 16 1/2-foot triangle (shown), or an 11- or 18-foot square. The triangle costs $89.95, from www.hammacherschlemmer.com. 6. The Brunswick is a 10-by-10-foot fabric gazebo that comes in a carry bag and assembles quickly. It is $109 from www.netmarket.com, which also offers 50 portable gazebos and outdoor canopies starting at $12; (888) 696-2753.

Not shown: A green-and-white-stripe hammock liner adds comfort to open-weave hammocks; $99.95 at www.hammacherschlemmer.com. A green-and-white stripe canopy attaches to a hammock; $140 at www.brookstone.com, or (877) 468-3580.
A full selection of hammocks in a variety of fabrics, plus accessories and hardware, are available at www.hammocks.com.
